definitions.definition: To unite , as two ropes , or parts of a rope, by a particular manner of interweaving the strands , the union being between two ends, or between an end and the body of a rope.
To unite, as spars , timbers , rails , etc., by lapping the two ends together, or by applying a piece which laps upon the two ends, and then binding , or in any way making fast.

examples: He argues against attempts to splice different genres or species of literature into a single composition.

definitions.definition: To remove intron sequences from the pre-messenger RNA, and then join together exons.
To add, remove and/or replace several array/data elements in one operation.

main_definition: To unite , as two ropes , or parts of a rope, by a particular manner of interweaving the strands , the union being between two ends, or between an end and the body of a rope.
secondary_definitions: To unite, as spars , timbers , rails , etc., by lapping the two ends together, or by applying a piece which laps upon the two ends, and then binding , or in any way making fast.
( figuratively ) To unite as if splicing.
( genetics ) To remove intron sequences from the pre-messenger RNA, and then join together exons.
( software engineering ) To add, remove and/or replace several array/data elements in one operation.
